pullsbody: For diversity reasons, it would be nice to try to avoid 'master' and 'slave' terminology in this repository which can be associated to slavery. The master-slave terminology could be problematic for people in several countries which has the history of slavery like Romania, USA and many others. Thank you for considering the proposal. Let me know if any changes in the PR are needed, I would be happy to implement them.
pull_commit_message: Discarding the master-slave language

pullsbody:
Brian, as you've been involved in the code changes on the a10n side, would you be willing to rubber stamp this?

I left the commit messages from https://github.com/mozilla-services/elmo-automation/commits/master/a10n/hg_elmo/utils.py, so you can see how they map.

The `Update Django to 1.11.x` commit there was the last time I had sync'ed between elmo and a10n before. That matches the `Django Deprecations` commit in https://github.com/mozilla/elmo/commits/master/apps/pushes/utils.py.

pull_commit_message:
bug 1628703, remove json-changesets as it's unused.

Release engineering only uses the plain-text version these days.
Let's remove this honeypot for people trying to break elmo.

pulltitle: bug 1597053, be vigilant about bytestrings coming out of hglib, r=adrian
pullsbody:
Adding a bytestring to the db in django 2.x gives "b'my byte string'".
For hex revisions, use ascii encoding, and for user-data utf-8.

Interestingly, this is getting me to pass tests up to django 2.2.x now. There's some things in the 2.1 realm that Pontoon will need, https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.0/releases/2.1/#features-removed-in-2-1 highlights the `django.contrib.auth.views.login` and friends, which Pontoon still uses, for example.
pull_commit_message:
bug 1597053, be vigilant about bytestrings coming out of hglib, r=adrian

Adding a bytestring to the db in django 2.x gives "b'my byte string'".
For hex revisions, use ascii encoding, and for user-data utf-8.
If unicode characters are passed in for the diff view, assume bad
intent and error early. We should really only have hashes, default,
and tip.

pulltitle: Prepare for django 2.x, final migration step and dangling processes/IO
pullsbody:
With py3, just doing `open` without a close is a warning. That's both for IO and processes, so let's more more careful about that.

Both of these commits get `python -W d manage.py test` down to things that are just problems in the django 1.11 code base.
pull_commit_message: bug 1597053, remove old migrations

pulltitle: Prepare for django 2.x, final migration step and dangling processes/IO
pullsbody:
With py3, just doing `open` without a close is a warning. That's both for IO and processes, so let's more more careful about that.

Both of these commits get `python -W d manage.py test` down to things that are just problems in the django 1.11 code base.
pull_commit_message: Fix dangling IO and processes

pulltitle: Squash migrations in preparation of Django 2.x
pull_commit_message:
bug 1597053, squash migrations as they come from the management command.

There's a few things `./manage.py squashmigrations` doesn't seem to do
automatically, fix those in a follow-up.

pulltitle: Squash migrations in preparation of Django 2.x
pull_commit_message:
bug 1597053, add initial data and optimize out `AlterField`

We made some initial data elidable, add that back, but make
the object creation optional. Unclear to me if that migration
is applied again.

Also, `./manage.py squashmigrations` didn't fold some `AlterField`
operations into `CreateModel`, optimize those out.

bug 1597053, MIDDLEWARE_CLASSES -> MIDDLEWARE

Wrap commonware middlewares with deprecation mixin to make them work
as MIDDLEWARE.

bug 1597053, bring migrations in sync with models

This is a prep step to squashing migrations later.
Also, let's make the content type deletion elidable. That means,
it can or can not run. Which is cool at this point, and allows
the squashing to squash over it.

Initialize rows_per_strip when RowsPerStrip tag is missing [#4034](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/4034) > [cgohlke, radarhere] > > - Raise error if TIFF dimension is a string [#4103](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/4103) > [radarhere] > > - Corrected negative seeks [#4101](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/4101) > [radarhere] > > - Added argument to capture all screens on Windows [#3950](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/3950) > [nulano, radarhere] > > - Updated warning to specify when Image.frombuffer defaults will change [#4086](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/4086) > [radarhere] > > - Changed WindowsViewer format to PNG [#4080](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/4080) > [radarhere] > > - pullsbody:
BuildRequest objects are really only important on build start, so I'm keeping
track of the last build request which is bound to one of the builds I delete
in retention. Then I delete all orphaned BuildRequest objects up to that one.

I also hook up clean_builds, but I tolerate that failing.
pull_commit_message:
bug 1552492, make build-retention command not shoot us on restarts.

BuildRequest objects are really only important on build start, so I'm keeping
track of the last build request which is bound to one of the builds I delete
in retention. Then I delete all orphaned BuildRequest objects up to that one.

I also hook up clean_builds, but I tolerate that failing.

pullsbody:

in retention. Then I delete all orphaned BuildRequest objects up to that one.

I also hook up clean_builds, but I tolerate that failing.
pull_commit_message: Follow-up to bug 1552492, make build retention less confusing to use

pullsbody:
As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please reach out to Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_

We're keeping an option for standard model auth for local

code.

consistently.

pullsbody:
This is mostly the headers we used to have, with some slight
modification for unsafe local hosting, I added 'self' to
connect-src.

Also, let's not pretend we should use unsafe external resources,
and hard-code https everywhere.

I guess this should be reviewed by @sciurus.

CC @EnTeQuAk, too, thanks for that quick release turn-around.
pull_commit_message:
Control CSP from within elmo.

This is mostly the headers we used to have, with some slight
modification for unsafe local hosting, I added 'self' to
connect-src.

Also, let's not pretend we should use unsafe external resources,
and hard-code https everywhere.

pulltitle: Convert progress spark from static files into a dynamic CSS.
pullsbody:
This is OK now that the progress view is faster. To ensure that
the CSS and the image are aligned, we're putting both into a single
resource, by using a data uri in the CSS.

Also, load this stylesheet lazily to not block rendering, that's not required.

The layout of the thumbs is extracted into a different stylesheet.
That's still rendered as it's settings-dependent, but loaded blockingly.

As we now have a view for progress.css, remove the old static from
the WHITELIST in the includes test.
pull_commit_message:
Convert progress spark from static files into a dynamic CSS.

This is OK now that the progress view is faster. To ensure that
the CSS and the image are aligned, we're putting both into a single
resource, by using a data uri in the CSS.

Also, load this stylesheet lazily to not block rendering, that's not required.

The layout of the thumbs is extracted into a different stylesheet.
That's still rendered as it's settings-dependent, but loaded blockingly.

As we now have a view for progress.css, remove the old static from
the WHITELIST in the includes test.
Merge branch 'release/2019-01-15'
Merge tag '2019-01-15' into develop
follow-up, remove unused fixture

Fix resource-check test.

This test tries to ensure that the included resources are actually somewhere.
It did so rather poorly, for example fat-fingering foo.css as foo.csss
didn't make this test fail.
We're including staticfiles unconditionally these days, so use it in our
tests, never actually call .get() to speed up tests, and use
urlparse() which is the first thing that .get() does.
This variety of the test catches a ton more resources, in particular js
with query strings.

pulltitle: Clean up ContentType and permissions in db through migration.
pullsbody:
We've taken a couple of migrations that removed apps and models that
didn't remove the content types or the permissions for them. Remove
them now.

The migration depends on that latest migration of all elmo apps with
data, so it's OK to access them virtually in the migration via get_model.
pull_commit_message:
bug 1520769, clean up ContentType and permissions in db through migration.

We've taken a couple of migrations that removed apps and models that
didn't remove the content types or the permissions for them. Remove
them now.

The migration depends on that latest migration of all elmo apps with
data, so it's OK to access them virtually in the migration via get_model.

Create AdminSite in the right way.

This is a refactor from trying to monkeypatch admin.site, to using
a dedicated subclass of AdminSite in elmo.urls.

Also, start patching site.urls instead of views, which should be more
portable.

This changelist is triggered by bug 1416451, where we don't show new FTL attributes.

I ended up refactoring the diff view, for which I refactored the test beforehand.

With the new setup, we can explicitly test the context data for the diff view for a particular content pair, without doing a ton of hg repo setup and such.

bug 1416451, refactor tests and DiffView, r?stas

Refactor DiffView to have a distinct method to get data from hg.
This allows us to unittest diffLines without setting up hg repos,
and we can test the diff code without rendering the template.

Test all of added, changed, copied, moved, removed actions that
paths4revs can pass on to diffLines.

pull_commit_message:
bug 1416451, make hg stage explicit, and per test

We want a different value for REPOSITORY_BASE per test run,
so move the override_settings explicit in setUp. Also,
don't use it as decorator nor context manager, but explicitly
do enable and disable for this.

This was the last thing that kept elmo from running tests in
parallel.

test fixture.

which feels wrong, too.

pulltitle: bug 1372559 - update compare view to handle both json formats
pullsbody:
This is 4 commits, the first two are cosmetic cleanup, removing dead code and flaking.
Then I transform the compare view to a class-based view, so that I can insert testing json data by subclassing, and create a test.
Then I add a second variant to detect the new json format, and adapt it slightly differently in a way that works for the template.

Tested against a local setup with the new version of compare-locales, and missing/obsolete and errors all work.

pull_commit_message: bug 1372559, support new and old json data format from compare-locales

bug 1138550, allow local clones to be unified for forked hg repos

Introduce a factored method on Repository.local_path to get
the local path to a repo, and use it throughout where we
used to access REPOSITORY_BASE.

Also test the diff use cases. I'm hoping to remove json-changesets
soon, so not spending too much time on automated tests on that.

I verified manually that in the forked scenario of divergent diffs,
pushes.tests.test_diff:DiffTestCase.test_local_path_of_divergent_fork,
the mocked moves/etc logic isn't used anymore, so once all
repos are properly unified locally, we can rip that out.

bug 1138550, add management command to introduce forks.

The management command also pulls the repositories from
the forks into the shared clone, so that the local clones are
ready to use.

It doesn't remove the forks, as that could be tricky.

bug 1138550, address review comments, r=mathjazz

Also, self-review nit, added blank=True and default=None

pulltitle: bug 1290906, resolve default or tip to the last known default changes
pullsbody:
et in the db, r?rail

Resolving 'default' is slow, and as soon as we use unified repos on elmo, also
wrong. Let's pick the last changeset of the default branch from the db, and use
an explicit version when talking to hg.
I'm also aliasing this to tip, which is not strictly true always, but it
shouldn't be used to begin with.
Better fix would be to just not have this code path at all, which is
bug 1280730.
pull_commit_message:
bug 1290906, resolve default or tip to the last known default changeset in the db, r=rail

Resolving 'default' is slow, and as soon as we use unified repos on elmo, also
wrong. Let's pick the last changeset of the default branch from the db, and use
an explicit version when talking to hg.
I'm also aliasing this to tip, which is not strictly true always, but it
shouldn't be used to begin with.
Better fix would be to just not have this code path at all, which is
bug 1280730.

pyelasticsearch in 0.6.1, six in 1.5.2
bug 857107, whitespace-only change to bugogram data due to simplejson

bug 857107, load compare-locales data from elasticsearch as well as logs

Load compare-locales comparison objects from elasticsearch, and still
from buildbot log files.
Also add a command that allows to migrate the build logs into
elasticsearch.
